description.narrative: Phase II - The main goal of HIV project is to achieve universal access to HIV services as well as prevention, treatment, care and support that enables people living with HIV to live fulfilling life.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Prevention programs for people who inject drugs (PWID) and their partners - 16,909 (73.2% of) people who inject drug (PWID) reached by prevention services - - 12,705 (31.5% of) PWID that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 62% of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Prevention programs for sex workers and their clients - 9,870 (70.0% of) sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services -7,755 (55.0% of) sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for MSM and TGs - 7,370 (55.0% of) MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 3,350 (25.0% of) MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for other vulnerable populations (please specify) - 7,800 (78.0% of) other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services (prison inmates) - 6,240 (62.4% of) other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results (prison inmates)
Treatment, care and support - 8,800 (60.4% of) adults and children currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV - 1,316 (90.0% of) adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
PMTCT - 100.0% of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission - 100.0% of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
TB/HIV - 100.0% of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings - 100.0% of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy - 100.0% of HIV-positive new and relapse TB p

comment.narrative:
Prevention programs for people who inject drugs (PWID) and their partners - 14,079 (60.9% of) people who inject drug (PWID) reached by prevention services - - 7,284 (31.5% of) PWID that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 54.4% of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Prevention programs for sex workers and their clients - 7,050 (50.0% of) sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - - 3,772 (26.8% of) sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for MSM and TGs - 5,747 (42.9% of) MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 521 (3.9% of) MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for other vulnerable populations (please specify) - 5,035 (50.0% of) other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services (prison inmates) - 3,650 (36.5% of) other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results (prison inmates)
Treatment, care and support - 4002 (24.5% of) adults and children currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV - 118 (72.0% of) adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
PMTCT - 56.3% of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission - 46.5% of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
TB/HIV - 98.7% of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings - 69.1% of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy - 94.8% of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients

Prevention programs for people who inject drugs (PWID) and their partners - 15,940 (69%) of people who inject drug (PWID) reached by prevention services; - 11,557 (50%) of PWID that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 60% of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Prevention programs for sex workers (SW) and their clients - 9,588 (68%) of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 6,345 (45%) of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results.
Prevention programs for MSM and TGs - 7,300 (54,5%) of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 2,555 (19,1 %) of MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for other vulnerable populations - 6,700 (67%) of other vulnerable populations (prison inmates) reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 4,690 (46,9%) of other vulnerable populations (prison inmates) that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Treatment, care and support - 7,500 (51.5%) of adults and children currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV - 711 (85%) of adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml).
PMTCT - 99,1% (317/320) of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission. - 90% of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth.
TB/HIV - 100% of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings - 95% of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy - 95% of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment

Prevention programs for people who inject drugs (PWID) and their partners - 14,165 (61.32%) of people who inject drug (PWID) reached by prevention services; - 13,938 (60.34%) of PWID that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 59.4% of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months

PMTCT - 97.3% (220/226) of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission. - 76.8% of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth.
